title: What will a 12th pass out student will do who has taken commerce? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is commerce? Do you know? Let me explain you. In very simple words, “Commerce is a branch of any business which covers the economical part of the legal, social, political, technological and cultural system”. Commerce is the choice of a big community of the students. The students, who wish to work in a corporate world, usually select the commerce field in their education and wish to appear the CAT Examination. Commerce count the all activities those are involved in the exchange of goods and services considered to the money, between the person and companies.Commerce is the only backbone which may cause the market and the economy of the company. One of the most confusing questions for the students is what to do after 12th commerce with maths or without maths?You can go for: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com)Bachelor of Management Studies (BMS)Bachelor of Business Studies (BBS)Bachelor in Business Management/Administration (BBM/A)Master of Commerce (M.Com)Master in Business Administration (MBA)BusinessOperationsFinanceMarketingBankingHRChartered Accountancy (CA)Chartered Financial Analyst Program (CFA)Company Secretary Program (CS).Jobs & Career option Once the student gets into this field he has to face the very first question as:Which are the career options available in commerce field?The commerce is one of the three basic and broad fields of the education. Another two are the Science stream and Arts/Humanitiesstream. You can join the government sectors or the private sectors.You can be a part of the corporate world as the analyst, executive, banker, Sr. executive or manager. There are a lot of job opportunities in the commercial field.You can choose one of the below fields as per the specialization of your degree: EconomicsMathematics and StatisticsAccountingBankingChartered AccountantsCompany SecretaryCWAStock BrokingAgriculture EconomicsManagement

Well for commerce candidates many fields are open. A general bachelors degree in commerce (BCom), management studies(BMS) business studies(BBS), business economics (BBE),economics(Economics Honours), business administration (BBA). These will generally prepare you for MBA in their course content. Then there are certifications you can do side by side. For accountancy there are CA, ICWA/CMA, International CMA, ACCA, CIMA. For financial advisory there are CFA, CIWM, CWM, FRM, CFP, CMT, NISM Certifications, ChFC etc. (there are many) For HR there are Lean, Six Sigma, Business Analyst Course (by some San Jose based entity, some IBA or something I don't remember) etc. For company law there is CS. Then there are Humanities Subjects you can pursue, which are more varied than Science or Commerce streams. These are generally offered by state/government universities and categorized into various categories like Law, Languages, Social Studies related subjects (Political Science, History, Geography etc.) and others (HRM, Psychology, Journalism, Education etc.). Also there are science related subjects you can do degree in after completeing commerce or arts stream, provided you have a certain subject (like mathematics), such as BA (Maths, BCA etc. Also after graduation you can get into many PSUs and government jobs with commerce or arts stream such as SSC CGL, IBPS, SBI Associate banks and SBI PO/Clerk, LIC AAO, RBI Assistant/Assistant grade B/A officer, UPSC Civil services Exam, Indian Economic Services/Indian Statistical Services (provided economics or statistics was taught to you in graduation as subject in your course), CDS (army non-technical, short service commission, aur force ground duty), Post office exams, etc. Also after MBA you can give management trainee or specialist post exams in RBI, SBI and IBPS. Plus there are private jobs available too as consultants, managers, executive etc. in different departments. Also lecturership is a viable option after completing masters and giving NET.
